results.firPara: Antonio Conte had never heard of NGolo Kanté until his rise to prominence with Leicester City last season, but now he believes the Chelsea player is a complete midfielder.
results.secPara: Asked whether he had been aware of Kanté before his move from Caen in August 2015, Conte said No, I must be honest.
results.webTitle: Antonio Conte hails in-form N’Golo Kanté as ‘the complete midfielder’

results.firPara: • Ex-Manchester United manager dismissed Chelsea as title challengers
results.secPara: Antonio Conte had done a sterling job in fudging his responses to questions about his teams role in the title race but there was the merest hint of a mask slipping when it was put to him that Sir Alex Ferguson, quoted last week, had not included Chelsea in his five-strong list of Premier League contenders.
results.webTitle: Chelsea and Conte gather momentum to make Alex Ferguson eat his words

results.firPara: The Barcelona midfielder admits his time in Manchester was probably too soon for both parties and is impressed with Pep Guardiolas changes
results.secPara: The Barcelona midfielder admits his time in Manchester was probably too soon for both parties and is impressed with Pep Guardiolas changes
results.webTitle: Denis Suárez: 'When I signed Manchester City were more English, now it’s a global club’

results.firPara: • Sunderland equal record for worst start to a Premier League season
results.secPara: David Moyes has pledged to keep doing what he does after Sunderlands latest setback ensured they plunged to a record-equalling nadir. Two goals apiece from Alexis Sánchez and Olivier Giroud in a 4-1 home defeat against Arsenal left Moyess bottom‑placed team with two points.
results.webTitle: David Moyes refuses to panic despite Sunderland’s 4-1 loss to Arsenal

results.firPara: • Striker a special player – we need him a lot says Manchester City manager
results.secPara: • Striker a special player – we need him a lot says Manchester City manager
results.webTitle: Sergio Agüero to start against Barcelona in Champions League, says Guardiola

results.firPara: Arnaud Djoum rescued a draw for Hearts as the Edinburgh side fought back to share the spoils in a 3-3 thriller with Inverness in the Highland capital.
results.secPara: David Raven volleyed Inverness into the lead after 15 minutes and Lonsana Doumbouya hit the crossbar before he doubled the home teams advantage.
results.webTitle: Scottish roundup: Scott McDonald scores as Motherwell beat Ross County

results.firPara: On a day when all three of the Premier Leagues pacesetters flexed their attacking muscles, Liverpool relied on their own lust for goals to turn a potentially awkward contest into a celebration of blistering intent.
results.secPara: Crystal Palace contributed to a captivating encounter, twice pegging back Liverpool as they endeavoured to contain the surges from the away team – no mean feat – but Jürgen Klopps team were in one of those moods where they ooze goals. Philippe Coutinho and Roberto Firmino showcased bewitching skills. Sadio Mané should have helped himself to a strike or two himself. There was so much forward momentum it was not unreasonable to forget they even had Daniel Sturridge back waiting in those familiar wings.
results.webTitle: Roberto Firmino rounds off Liverpool’s goal rush at Crystal Palace

results.firPara: A wonderful performance from Philippe Coutinho inspired Liverpool to a thrilling win at Selhurst Park in a superb game
results.secPara: Peep peep! Liverpool stay in touch with Manchester City and Arsenal after a thrilling attacking performance in a highly enjoyable game. If they do win their first title since 1990, they are going to do it in style. Thanks for your company, goodnight.
results.webTitle: Crystal Palace v Liverpool: Premier League - live!

results.firPara: Derby see off Sheffield Wednesday at the iPro, Newcastle do the double over Preston, Leeds United continue good home run and Carlisle remain unbeaten in League Two
results.webTitle: Football League your thoughts: Derby extend home run as Newcastle win again

results.firPara: Chris Hughton taught his former side a harsh lesson in the realities of the Championship as Brighton picked off a fragile visiting side and left Alex Neil ruing the worst defeat in his short managerial career.
results.secPara: What had been billed as a tight encounter between evenly matched rivals ended up as a rout. Goals from Lewis Dunk and Anthony Knockaert complemented a Glenn Murray hat-trick and left home fans believing they can improve on last seasons third-place finish. Norwich, who led the league 13 days ago, ended the day confronting each other in heated dressing room exchanges.
results.webTitle: Murray hits hat-trick as Chris Hughton makes point with Norwich thrashing
